body: Which autor drew the manga on 125 page?
yet seeing shota and loli is a rarer mix
FINALLY! I was waiting for the next vol

Fair enough. For me though, there are a couple of my favorites in here that keep it interesting. Show and Naoshi are always incredible and of course Satuyo has a very cute artstyle (tan tomboys are honestly top tier).

@NorwegianboyEE One or two “good” stories in a anthology of a dozen or so does not make the comic as a whole significantly better or different. As I said, it’s lackluster, it’s not bad, it’s just that compared to the last couple releases we’ve had, I personally find it to be on the weaker end of the spectrum overall. I recognize that there are some “domination”-centric doujins in here, it’s why I stated “most” instead of “all”. But to me, personally, even those fall a bit short in comparison to other works by the authors in various aspects. All of this is my personal opinion on it though, obviously I’m sure a good number of people are gonna love this *because* it’s mostly vanilla, it’s just not where my tastes lie.
My main reason for watch this is the wholesome comic put at last. I love Kiki and yuu

@DoujinsRLove
Isn’t there literally a bondage loli doujin by Rico-san in this issue?

Idk, even with some top tier artists in here, I just find this one kinda lackluster. Maybe it’s the fact that most of them are just straight romance-vanilla without even a semblance of “domination” (I’m fucked up, so are all of you, deal with it). But I just personally find it to be lacking, and I’m usually more accepting of vanilla with Lolis, because it’s -generally- inherently  “dominating” in portrayal.

 P.S I really don’t like where Hikoma Hiroyuki is going with this series. He’s extremely talented, so I truly hope he doesn’t stick with this vore-egg-tentacle shit (tentacles are relatively okay, the other 2 are not) and simply goes back to making some truly god tier -normal- loli doujins. This has been your regular hentai breakdown from yours truly: Too Much Time Man
